title.narrative: Final steps of the first phase: get access to finance for the construction of an accredited warehouse facility

description.narrative:
Muhorro Area Co-operative Enterprise (MACE) is a an autonomous organisation, located in Muhorro Sub County, Buyaga County, Kibaale District. It started and registered in 2005 under the Co-operative Institutions Statute, 1991 and Co-operative Regulations, 1992. MACE is a farmer owned and democratically controlled co-operative enterprise, formed voluntarily by 10 primary producer co-operative societies. Since inception, MACE has been able to mobilize farmers to form 12 primary producer co-operative Societies, 1 Savings and Credit Co-operative Organization (Farmers Village Bank) and 1 Area Co-operative Enterprise.
Muhorro Area Co-operative Enterprise (MACE) has been thoroughly assessed by Agriterra by means of a scoping assessment, which took place in June 2011 and subsequently a company assessment in August 2011. These assessments revealed that MACE has the capacity to implement the plans which they formulated in their business plan “Co-operative rice processing and marketing” for the BID Competition: Farmers in Business. As the business plan emphasizes a whole spectrum of activities to increase the incomes of farmers, a step by step approach is necessary. Therefore, this action plan focuses on the final steps of getting access to finance. Access to finance is necessary to fund the construction of the warehouse, but an increase of the loan through MUSACCO to sustain the Warehouse Receipt System is essential as well. To summarize, the objectives of this action plan are: • Strengthen the existing Warehouse Receipt System (WRS) by increasing the loan for crop financing. • Negotiate loans with financial institutions in Uganda • Reduction of post-harvesting losses and improvement of quality of maize and rice
The support provided by Agriterra consists of among others improving the financial management, improving accessibility to the internet. MACE will focus on training to farmers, among others in improved post-harvest handling.
The goal of this project is to start the preparation work for utimately constructing a warehouse facility. The preparation work focuses on: • Strengthen the existing Warehouse Receipt System (WRS) for improved crop financing and collateralization of produce. • Reduction of post-harvesting losses and improvement of quality of maize and rice • Preparatory work for developing a business plan for the construction of an Accredited Warehouse facility, like making (cost/benefit) analyses and comparing alternatives.
